meanings.definition: Squarks (noun): A hypothetical elementary particle predicted by some theories of particle physics.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study squarks to understand the smallest building blocks of matter.
meanings.sent2: The concept of squarks plays a crucial role in advanced physics research.
meanings.sent3: When the squarks collided, they created a burst of energy that amazed everyone.
meanings.sent4: The squarks danced around each other like tiny, elusive puzzle pieces.
meanings.sent5: In the world of particle physics, squarks are like hidden treasures waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: Squarks (verb): To make a high-pitched, harsh cry or sound.
meanings.sent1: The baby bird squarks loudly for its mother to bring food.
meanings.sent2: The seagull squarks as it circles above looking for fish.
meanings.sent3: The cat squarks playfully when chasing a toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The old door squarks in protest as it swings open slowly.
meanings.sent5: The monkey squarks in excitement when it sees a banana approaching.

meanings.definition: Squarks (adjective): Describing a loud, harsh noise or cry.
meanings.sent1: The squarks cry of the seagull echoed across the beach.
meanings.sent2: The squarks sound of the car brakes startled the pedestrians.
meanings.sent3: The squarks noise of the thunderstorm kept everyone awake at night.
meanings.sent4: The squarks cry of the baby woke up the entire household.
meanings.sent5: The squarks howl of the wind made the trees sway violently.
